definitions.definition: A soft, waxy, silvery reactive metal that is never found unbound in nature; an element ( symbol K) with an atomic number of 19 and atomic weight of 39.0983. The symbol is derived from the Latin kalium .
A single atom of this element.

main_definition: A soft, waxy, silvery reactive metal that is never found unbound in nature; an element ( symbol K) with an atomic number of 19 and atomic weight of 39.0983. The symbol is derived from the Latin kalium .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A single atom of this element.
